gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.jdbc
Class AbstractJdbcWorker

java.lang.Object
  gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.workers.AbstractBaseWorker
      gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.workers.AbstractResourceConsumer
          gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.jdbc.AbstractJdbcWorker
All Implemented Interfaces:
Worker
Direct Known Subclasses:
GenericStoredDynamicEntitiesQuery, GenericStoredDynamicPoQuery, JdbcCommand, JdbcPersistenceWorker, JdbcQuery, JdbcQuestion, StoredDynamicPoQuery
public abstract class AbstractJdbcWorker
extends AbstractResourceConsumer

Abstract base class for worker implementations based on JDBC. JDBC based implementations of Worker use prepared statement for database operations. The SQL statements are defined as string fields of the class. These fields have to be annotated with the annotation SQL.

prepare

protected void prepare(String sql)
                throws DataException
Creates a PreparedStatement from the sql string. Parameter markers are defined in the sql staring with question marks. Alternatively parameter markers can be marked with named parameters using a parameter name preceded by a colon (:). The logical schema string will be replaced by the actual schema string. The prepared statement is created and put to the statements map with key the sql parameter.

Examples of valid statements are: select foo, bar from MYTABLE where foo > ?
select foo, bar from MYTABLE where foo > :foo

Parameters:
sql - String for the sql statement.
Throws:
DataException

Returns:

init

public void init(Provider parent)
          throws InitializationException
Description copied from interface: Worker
Introduces the runtime context (environment) to the worker. The parent provides the runtime context. The runtime context can be anything that facilitates access to any back-end system (Databases, Files, Application Server etc).
Different implementations of Worker, will require from their parent provider resources of different types. Sub-interfaces of Provider can provide resources of any type. The implementations of worker must get the specific sub-type of Provider by their parent by calling the method parent.getProvider(subclass) where subclass is the sub-interface of Provider that is required.

Specified by:
init in interface Worker
Overrides:
init in class AbstractResourceConsumer
Parameters:
parent - The runtime provider
Throws:
InitializationException - When the parent fails to provide the resources required by the worker.

open

public void open()
          throws DataException
Description copied from interface: Worker
Prepares the worker. Creation or initialization of any attribute that requires runtime dependent resources takes place here.

Specified by:
open in interface Worker
Overrides:
open in class AbstractBaseWorker
Throws:
DataException - When the preparation of the worker fails.

close

public void close()
           throws DataException
Description copied from interface: Worker
Worker cleanup. Cleanup of any resources that were created by the worker. These resources are created by the open() method. Resources provided by the parent provider in the init(Provider p) method belong to the parent and their state should not be modified by the worker.

Specified by:
close in interface Worker
Overrides:
close in class AbstractBaseWorker
Throws:
DataException - When the cleanup fails.
